items.preText: Alright then. We're in the business end of this game. Bangladesh need 39 off four overs.
items.text: full, and very wide outside off. He gets down on one knee, and drives to long off
much needed six! In the slot outside off, nad Mosaddek stays on the back foot before muscling a lofted shot over extra cover. Powerful
items.postText: Aranya: "What you meant to say was "We're in the endgame now"."
items.shortText: Roach to Mosaddek Hossain, SIX runs

items.text: nearly a yorker, just outside off, and guided down to third man
full toss, wide outside off, but manages to drag a shot to wide long on. Can't keep it down to a single
full, wide outside off, and he flays a square drive. Stopped by the sweeper-fielder on the off side
yorker, on off. Dug away to third man
items.postText: tadj: "that was some ordinary and defensive minded captaincy from holder, u hadda search for the wicket even if its a 12 run over should have gone gabriel "

items.preText: Bangladesh need 27 off 18. If this was a T20 game, you'd back them. Right? Riiiight?
items.text: switch hit for six! Half-tracker on middle, but he goes left-handed right away, and then slogs it over the point boundary for half-a-dozen. How about that?
items.shortText: Allen to Mosaddek Hossain, SIX runs

items.text: Hossain the hero! Full, on off, and he comes down the wicket to lift a six over long off! The crowd's ecstatic
items.shortText: Allen to Mosaddek Hossain, SIX runs

items.text: another one! Bangladesh are romping home now. Quicker from Allen, and Mosaddek is halfway down the track, but he sticks his bat out to play a late cut for four. Delicate
items.shortText: Allen to Mosaddek Hossain, FOUR runs

items.text: holy guacamole! Full, on leg, and Mosaddek exposes all three stumps before playing a beautiful inside-out six over cover
items.shortText: Allen to Mosaddek Hossain, SIX runs

items.text: length ball on middle, and clipped off his pads to deep midwicket. Half-century for Mosaddek
length ball on middle, and tucked away to square leg. He'll keep strike
items.postText: Fastest ODI fifty for Bangladesh from Mosaddek

items.text: full, just outside off, and tapped to cover
items.shortText: Reifer to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: length ball, just outside off and going through to the keeper
items.shortText: Reifer to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: slower ball, full outside off, and driven to deep point. Scores are level
length ball, on off, and he defends!
Bangladesh win their first ever ODI tournament final! Historic as Mahmudullah crashes a cover drive through the off side
items.postText: 7.46pm That's all from us at ESPNcricinfo. Hope you enjoyed our coverage of this historic Bangladesh win. A lot for Jason Holder and West Indies to worry out. Keep an eye out on our website tomorrow morning, because West Indies are supposed to release their final World Cup squad then. Till then, it's goodbye. Azweer: "@Tamim Sarker: so it's gonna be a double dhamaka in Dhaka" 7.41pm Smiles in the Bangladesh camp. Mortaza hugs coach Rhodes after giving a mighty cuddle to Soumya Sarkar Shishir : "Finally first multinational tournament trophy!! Congratulations Bangla Tigers!! From Nepal!!" Aj : "For the love of God Keemo Paul in for Roach please " Shuvashish Roy: "We have never seen such well-poised and synchronised Bangladesh cricket team before. This would be our World Cup. #ShabashBangladesh" Azweer: "So tomorrow will be a national holiday in Bangladesh....!!!" Noise.of.silenc: "-What do we say to the GOD of cricket??? -NOT TODAY! ;)" Tamim Sarker: "@Azweer- Its already national holiday for us tomorrow! Buddha Purnima" Hridoy: "Mosaddek was 7 from 9 ball. And reached fifty in 20th ball. This is some hitting." Dr. Engr. Md. M: "Congratulations Bangladesh Cricket Team for the wonderful victory. Worth to see the match without sleeping." 7.40pm Terrific scenes in the Bangladesh camp. They've won with seven balls to spare. It wasn't easy, with Shakib unavailable, but they were terrific in the last four overs of West Indies' innings after which their batsmen kept the tempo going through the innings. First, it was Soumya Sarkar, who struck a half-century in 27 balls. Mushfiqur Rahim chipped in too, but when it mattered, Mosaddek Hossain stood up to take his team through. ador: "Wonderful batting display, wonderful Soumya, wonderful Mosaddek! "
